summary: Completed comprehensive testing of GameShop Nepal e-commerce website iteration 2. Fixed FAQ reorder API bug (route ordering issue). All backend tests pass (18/18). Frontend features working correctly.

fixed.issue: Route was being matched by /faqs/{faq_id} due to route ordering. Moved reorder route before parameterized routes.

issues: Discord social link has no icon (getIcon function doesn't handle Discord platform). Only affects Discord - Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, TikTok icons work correctly.

passed_tests: Homepage loads correctly without Contact link in navigation
Admin button removed from public navigation
Footer shows Terms & Conditions link (not Contact)
Social media icons in footer working (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, TikTok)
Terms and Conditions page loads at /terms
Admin login works with gsnadmin/gsnadmin
Admin FAQs page - create, edit, delete, reorder FAQs
Admin Products page - view products with tags, reorder products
Public FAQ page displays FAQs from database
Admin sidebar shows FAQs link
Backend API root endpoint (200 OK)
Admin authentication (login with fixed credentials)
Registration disabled (403)
FAQ CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete)
FAQ reorder API
Social links API (returns Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, TikTok, Discord)
Products API with tags and sort_order fields
Categories API
Pages API (terms, about, faq)
Reviews API
action_items: Minor: Add Discord icon support in Footer.jsx getIcon function if Discord social link should display an icon
critical_code_review_comments: Route ordering in FastAPI: Static routes like /faqs/reorder must be defined BEFORE parameterized routes like /faqs/{faq_id} to avoid incorrect matching
context_for_next_testing_agent: All core features working. FAQ reorder bug was fixed by moving the /faqs/reorder route before /faqs/{faq_id}. Discord icon missing in footer is a minor enhancement. Products have tags and sort_order fields but current products don't have tags assigned.

rca_of_the_issue.root_cause: FastAPI route matching order - /faqs/reorder was defined after /faqs/{faq_id}, causing 'reorder' to be matched as a faq_id parameter. The update_faq endpoint expected FAQItemCreate (dict) but received a list.
rca_of_the_issue.fix: Moved @api_router.put('/faqs/reorder') route definition before @api_router.put('/faqs/{faq_id}') in server.py
rca_of_the_issue.prevention: Always define static routes before parameterized routes in FastAPI
